page.title: 10POLLARD'S MONSTER - 2
page.content: Lord Mitford, passing on his way to London and hearing of the reward took the beast's head from Pollard while he slept. When Pollard awoke he hastened to the Bishop's Palace. The Bishop was dining and not wishing to be disturbed sent word that for his reward he might ride around while the Bishop dined. Pollard at once rode round Auckland Castle and claimed the castle and its contents. To redeem the castle the Bishop agreed to grant Pollard the freehold estate, still known by his name. Meanwhile Lord Mitford arrived in London and received the King's award. Althugh Pollard follwed and produced the creature's tongue to support his claim, he was ignored but retained his land. Tenure is mentioned as early as 1402. Pollard's family became extinct in the reign of Elizabeth I.
